name: RIA:RIA_2011_Economic_Indicators
title: LGA Economic Fundamentals Indicators 2011

legal.licenceType: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Australia (CC BY-NC 3.0 AU)

abstract:
This data has been created by the Regional Australia Institute for the [In]Sight competitive index, released in 2012. Modeled on the World Economic Forum"s Global Competitiveness Report, [In]Sight was developed in collaboration with Deloitte Access Economics and combines data from sources including the Australian Bureau of Statistics and the Social Health Atlas of Australia.

Economic conditions determine the quality of the general economic climate in a region. Economic stability is a key factor in ensuring high levels of trust in the market for both consumers and producers. High levels of trust lead to high long term investment rates (by businesses and households), which are an integral component of competitiveness. Conversely, uncertainty acts as a deterrent to investment, thereby decreasing competitiveness.

selectedAttributes.name: LGA2011
selectedAttributes.title: LGA Code
selectedAttributes.description: The ABS code of the LGA

selectedAttributes.name: State
selectedAttributes.title: State
selectedAttributes.description: The state within which the LGA is located

selectedAttributes.name: Econ_SD
selectedAttributes.title: Economic Fundamentals Indicator Standard Deviation
selectedAttributes.description: The standard deviation of the Economic Fundamentals Indicator, representing how well a LGA is performing relative to a national "average Australian region"

selectedAttributes.name: Econ_Rank
selectedAttributes.title: Economic Fundamentals Indicator Ranking
selectedAttributes.description: The Rank of the Economic Fundamentals Indicator from 1-560 out of 560 Local Government Areas, based on the Standard Deviation

selectedAttributes.name: BuildApp
selectedAttributes.title: Value of building approvals ("000)
selectedAttributes.description: The total value of building approvals within the LGA ("000)

selectedAttributes.name: ResPop
selectedAttributes.title: Resident population
selectedAttributes.description: The total resident population for the LGA

selectedAttributes.name: BA_meas
selectedAttributes.title: Building Approvals
selectedAttributes.description: Measurement: Value of building approvals per capita ("000) (Source: ABS Cat 8731.0 - Building Approvals Australia, datacubes )

selectedAttributes.name: BA_sd
selectedAttributes.title: Building approvals Standard Deviation
selectedAttributes.description: The standard deviation of the Measure, representing how well a LGA is performing relative to a national "average Australian region"

selectedAttributes.name: BA_rank
selectedAttributes.title: Building approvals Ranking
selectedAttributes.description: The Rank of the Measure from 1-560 out of 560 Local Government Areas, based on the Standard Deviation

selectedAttributes.name: Incm_meas
selectedAttributes.title: Wage/labour costs
selectedAttributes.description: Measurement: Average wage and salary income (Source: 5673.0.55.003 - Wage and salary earner statistics for small areas, Table 3A)

selectedAttributes.name: Incm_sd
selectedAttributes.title: Wage/labour costs Standard Deviation
selectedAttributes.description: The standard deviation of the Measure, representing how well a LGA is performing relative to a national "average Australian region"

selectedAttributes.name: Incm_rank
selectedAttributes.title: Wage/labour costs Ranking
selectedAttributes.description: The Rank of the Measure from 1-560 out of 560 Local Government Areas, based on the Standard Deviation

selectedAttributes.name: BsCI_meas
selectedAttributes.title: Business confidence
selectedAttributes.description: Measurement: Confidence levels in the prospects of business over the next twelve months (higher rating/measurement, greater business confidence) (Source: Expert Survey)

selectedAttributes.name: BsCI_sd
selectedAttributes.title: Business confidence Standard Deviation
selectedAttributes.description: The standard deviation of the Measure, representing how well a LGA is performing relative to a national "average Australian region"

selectedAttributes.name: BsCI_rank
selectedAttributes.title: Business confidence Ranking
selectedAttributes.description: The Rank of the Measure from 1-560 out of 560 Local Government Areas, based on the Standard Deviation
